title: BEARS - Dare The Limits
text:
< >   




Our work is split up in three working groups:

The Experimental Rocketry group currently develops multiple rockets. These rockets are built based on solid-propellant engines. A bi-propellant engine and a test environment are in progress. The goal is to merge the work on rockets and on bi-propellant engines in the future.
The Science and Experiments group develops and operates science experiments and payloads. Furthermore, it develops, designs and builds satellite components and systems.
In the Robotics group, robotic systems are designed, built, tested and operated. Currently, the group is focused on robotic implementation of in situ resource utilization technologies for various space environments. One of the projects in this area is the development of a mobile solar smelter which heats up the regolith on the surface of the moon to melting temperatures using sunlight. The goal is to create a sealed surface which can benefit various lunar construction ambitions like building roads or foundations.

Regardless of your academic background, if you are interested you can contact us via mail or on Instagram. Otherwise, you can join us in our weekly meeting Tuesdays at 6 pm in the F11 at the ILR.

title: Rover
text:
Of course, we are also involved in building rovers. This September 2023 we participated in the European Rover Competition in Poland for the 2nd time. Thereby we reached the 12th place. In rover building, we work together with the international students from the Master of Space Engineering.

< >

title: Propulsion
text:
In the rocket propulsion team, we are working on a liquid gas propulsion system. In the long term, this should power our own rocket. Currently, the planning has been completed and we are ordering the first components. When the first tests take place, you will of course find out on our BEARS Instagram channel.

< >

title: WOBBLE2
text: News: Our team got invited to present the WOBBLE2 idea in Bonn. On the 27.-28.11 three of us will present the experiment idea in front of a jury of the DLR. The results will be published on 18.12.

title: WOBBLE2
text:
The Team
A motivated team has been formed for DLR’s 15th Rexus competition. The application was submitted on October 9 and we are currently preparing for the selection workshop. We are 8 enthusiastic students covering all areas from electrical design to flow simulation. Three of us will take part in the selection workshop in Bonn from November 27-28.11.2023. This time, an experiment on new 3D printed tanks is to be carried out.

title: WOBBLE2
text:
Experiment Idea
WOBBLE2 stands for Weightless Observation of Behaviour with Berlin Liquid Guidance Experiment. We are planing to test new propellant management devices (PMD) for satellite tanks. We want to use additive manufacturing techniques as well as develop new PMD designs that are only possible with the new manufacturing technology. During the microgravity phase in the REXUS-Rocket the Fluid will be observed with a camera. The liquid is pumped to simulate different fill levels and dynamic movements.

title: WOBBLE2
Solar
text:
In the SOLAR group, we are working on a system with which lunar regolith simulant (Moon dust) can be melted. The main component is a Fresnel lens that concentrates the sunlight. The goal of this is to build dust free areas in the future on the Moon utilizing the resources in-situ. Initial tests have successfully created small areas. Now, we are in the process of further developing the first prototype and testing different melting methods.

< >

title: Career
text:
The Career project is about reproducing the docking of 2 satellites. For this purpose 2 robot arms are used.



Concept of the Career project

title: Lars
text:
Lars (Lunar Astronaut Revival System) was a cardiac massage device designed to revive astronauts in their spacesuits. With our prototype we participated in the Asclepios–Mission 2. For this, a small team went to Lausanne. For 2023/24 we plan to participate in the competition again. This project is especially suitable for beginners and we are looking forward to your participation.

< >

title: Experimental Rocketry
text:
In the experimental rocket building group we build our own rockets. We have already achieved a successful launch to an altitude of 600m. Currently we are building a rocket that is designed to reach an altitude of 3 km. On this also a small experiment is to be accomplished. We also want to participate in competitions with the new rocket.

< >

title: About BEARS
text:
Who are we?
We are the Berlin Experimental Astronautics Research Student Team e.V. a newly founded student association at the Technische Universität Berlin. Our club was founded on the 31th of May 2022 with the goal to provide students from all the discplines the opportunity to apply their theoretical knwoledege in practical space related projects.
In addition to the space projects, which you can find under projects here, we also do joint activities. We attend trade fairs and congresses together. Below you will find a small photo overview of latest joint activities.

< >

title: LARS on the Asclepios analog moon mission
text:
When we developed LARS (Lunar Astronaut Revival System), we weren’t sure what kind of material we want to use. We had high requirements regarding to the robustness of the most important components because of the high forces that are required for the CPR procedure. Luckily we came in touch with 3D-Druck & Design Rostock who were able to print the components out of a highly robust carbon nylon filament. We are excited to present you the final system which we used for our first test phase at the Asclepios analog moon mission at San Gottardo (Switzerland).

< >
